resources.string:
The __serve side buttons__ indicate 
 
- who should serve 
- from which side (L/R) 
- if it is a handout (?) 

The side or player changes automatically after each point entered. 

If required, you can toggle side/player by tapping it.
Keep track of __Stroke/Yes Let/No let__ decisions by tapping the name of the player requesting a let. \nEnter your decision in the dialog that appears.
You can also keep track of __Conduct Warning/Stroke__ decisions. \n \nLong-press a player button for a _Misconduct_ dialog.
An \'old fasioned\' scoring sheet is visible on the screen for your convenience. \n\nThis can be turned off via \'Settings\'.

This button will appear when an __official announcement__ is in order: 
 
 - Start of game/match 
 - End of game/match 
 - First tiebreak 

Press it to see the announcement.

If you are about to ref two players you never met before, and have a hard time remembering their names, you can __enter a color__ for both of them. \n\nLong click the serve side button to select a color.
The number of games already won by each player are visible here. \n \nTap it to see the exact scores of previous games.

This button will allow you to start a __timer__. 

It will only appear when appropriate 
 
- Warmup 
- Before start of first game 
- Between games 
 
If you happen to need a injury timer somewhere along a match, you can start one via the menu.

More options are available from the menu. You can for example: 
 
- Customize appearance and behaviour of the app via 'Settings' 
- Show details of previously reffed matches 
- Start an injury timer 
- Export/import all your reffed matches to/from a zip file 
- Consult an elaborate help page for this app 
- Consult the official squash rules 
- Enable options to easily record FH/BH Winner/Error statistics (e.g. for coaches/trainers while observing their pupils match)

A few more GUI hints: 
 
__Player buttons__ 
 
- Touch with two fingers to record a broken ball/strings/racket event 
- Swipe back and forth over one to edit (or provide more) match details 
- Swipe to the left over the servers name to switch serve side to Left, idem for right 
 
__Score buttons__ 
 
- Touch both at the same time to enter a start score (reffing a match that already started) 
- Long-Touch both to verify the format of the match in progress 
- Swipe diagonally back-and-forth over a score button to optionally restart the score (e.g. after demo-ing the app to fellow club members)
__That\'s it. Happy squashing, happy reffing.__ \n\nStart a new match by tapping this button.
